Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Playground

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Playground
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Playground extends Object implements Serializable
Playground of a single player, where the cards are placed
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Playground()
    Constructor of the playground Sets half of the cells as free and half as dead since the playground works as chessboard where you can only move on the white squares.

  • Constructor Details

    • Playground

      public Playground()
      Constructor of the playground Sets half of the cells as free and half as dead since the playground works as chessboard where you can only move on the white squares. It also initializes the attributes

  • Method Details

    • setSpace

      public int setSpace(Card card, int row, int column)
      Method that given a card and a position, places the card in the right space, covering adjacent corners and updating values
      Parameters:
      card - The card to place
      row - The integer representing the row index
      column - The integer representing the column index
      Returns:
      The integer representing the points made by placing the card, if any

    • setPlaygroundBeforePlace

      public void setPlaygroundBeforePlace(int row, int column, Card card)
      Removes a card from the playground updating the values of adjacent cards and items and resources counter
      Parameters:
      row - The integer representing the row index
      column - The integer representing the column index
      card - The card to remove

    • removeLastOrderedCoord

      public void removeLastOrderedCoord()
      Removes last card placed from the linked hash map, used when the player disconnects before drawing a card

    • countResources

      public int countResources(Resource res)
      Method that returns the amount available on the playground of a specified resource
      Parameters:
      res - The resource type we want to know the number
      Returns:
      The integer representing the number of the available specified resource

      public int countItems(Item it)
      Method that returns the amount available on the playground of a specified item
      Parameters:
      it - The item type we want to know the number
      Returns:
      The integer representing the number of the available specified item

      public Space getSpace(int row, int column)
      Method that returns the space in a specified position on the playground
      Parameters:
      row - The row where my space is
      column - The column where my space is
      Returns:
      The space in the specified position

      public int getNorthBound()
      Method that lowest row with at least one card, the northernmost one on the playground
      Returns:
      The integer representing the index of the northernmost row with a card

    • getOrderedCoords

      public Map<Card,int[]> getOrderedCoords()
      Method that returns a map of cards in the order they've been place
      Returns:
      the Map: Card, int[2], first int is row (y), the second is column (x)
